alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Coldest Temperatures of the Winter Season Thus Far Expected Tonight... Temperatures late tonight will fall quickly through the 40s, reaching the low to mid 30s across Lake, inland Volusia, and rural portions of Seminole and Orange counties. Some spots could see temperatures fall to near freezing, especially in wind- sheltered locations. Northerly winds of 10 mph will cause wind chills to fall to the mid to upper 20s in these same locations for several hours prior to sunrise Sunday morning. Widespread frost is not forecast due to elevated winds. For locations of cold weather shelters which may be open in your area, check with your local county emergency management. Consider sheltering pets indoors to protect them from the cold weather. Persons with cold sensitive plants may also need to cover them or bring them indoors. Be extra cautious if using space heaters and keep them well away from combustible material such as pillows, blankets, and curtains.

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole; Southern Lake County
